content.title: Error: File already exists
content.body:
View details in Rollbar: [https://app.rollbar.com/a/thomas.iniguez/fix/item/FirstProject/15](https://app.rollbar.com/a/thomas.iniguez/fix/item/FirstProject/15)

```

Error: File already exists
  File "C:\Users\alpha\youtube-public\src\updater.js", line 17, in WriteStream.<anonymous>
  File "node:events", line 530, in WriteStream.emit
  File "node:internal/streams/destroy", line 169, in emitErrorNT
  File "node:internal/streams/destroy", line 128, in emitErrorCloseNT
  File "node:internal/process/task_queues", line 82, in process.processTicksAndRejections
```
content.author: alphaleadership

acceptanceCriteria: The application should gracefully handle attempts to write to a file that already exists, without throwing a 'File already exists' error.
The `updater.js` logic should be reviewed to determine the intended behavior when a target file exists (e.g., overwrite, append, skip, or prompt).
The system should ensure that any file write operations initiated by `updater.js` do not lead to crashes or unexpected termination due to existing file conflicts.

details: The source code for `C:\Users\alpha\youtube-public\src\updater.js` is missing from the current project context. This file is crucial for understanding and debugging the 'File already exists' error.
Further details available on the provided Rollbar link (https://app.rollbar.com/a/thomas.iniguez/fix/item/FirstProject/15) could provide valuable context, but are not accessible.
